question: where did the british army launch a successful invasion in 1776
chain_of_thought_result: In 1776, the British Army launched a successful invasion in New York City. This invasion was part of the larger conflict known as the American Revolutionary War. The British aimed to capture New York as a strategic location to control the colonies and suppress the rebellion. The successful capture of New York City occurred after the Battle of Brooklyn (also known as the Battle of Long Island) in August 1776, where British forces defeated the Continental Army.
